entities.name: Case
entities.description: Service request case associated with a contract.

attributes.name: incidentId
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the case.

attributes.name: createdOn
attributes.description: Date and time when the record was created.

attributes.name: createdBy
attributes.description: Shows who created the record.

attributes.name: modifiedOn
attributes.description: Date and time when the record was modified.

attributes.name: modifiedBy
attributes.description: Shows who last updated the record.

attributes.name: createdOnBehalfBy
attributes.description: Shows who created the record on behalf of another user.

attributes.name: modifiedOnBehalfBy
attributes.description: Shows who last updated the record on behalf of another user.

attributes.name: ownerId
attributes.description: Owner Id

attributes.name: owningBusinessUnit
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the business unit that owns the record

attributes.name: owningUser
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the user that owns the record.

attributes.name: owningTeam
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the team that owns the record.

attributes.name: versionNumber
attributes.description: Version Number

attributes.name: emailAddress
attributes.description: The primary email address for the entity.

attributes.name: importSequenceNumber
attributes.description: Sequence number of the import that created this record.

attributes.name: overriddenCreatedOn
attributes.description: Date and time that the record was migrated.

attributes.name: timeZoneRuleVersionNumber
attributes.description: For internal use only.

attributes.name: UTCConversionTimeZoneCode
attributes.description: Time zone code that was in use when the record was created.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: Type a subject or descriptive name, such as the request, issue, or company name, to identify the case in Microsoft Dynamics 365 views.

attributes.name: processId
attributes.description: Contains the id of the process associated with the entity.

attributes.name: stageId
attributes.description: Contains the id of the stage where the entity is located.

attributes.name: traversedPath
attributes.description: A comma separated list of string values representing the unique identifiers of stages in a Business Process Flow Instance in the order that they occur.

attributes.name: activitiesComplete
attributes.description: This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.

attributes.name: actualServiceUnits
attributes.description: Type the number of service units that were actually required to resolve the case.

attributes.name: billedServiceUnits
attributes.description: Type the number of service units that were billed to the customer for the case.

attributes.name: blockedProfile
attributes.description: Details whether the profile is blocked or not.

attributes.name: caseOriginCode
attributes.description: Select how contact about the case was originated, such as email, phone, or web, for use in reporting and analysis.

attributes.name: caseTypeCode
attributes.description: Select the type of case to identify the incident for use in case routing and analysis.

attributes.name: checkEmail
attributes.description: This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.

attributes.name: contractDetailId
attributes.description: Choose the contract line that the case should be logged under to make sure the customer is charged correctly.

attributes.name: contractId
attributes.description: Choose the service contract that the case should be logged under to make sure the customer is eligible for support services.

attributes.name: contractServiceLevelCode
attributes.description: Select the service level for the case to make sure the case is handled correctly.

attributes.name: customerId
attributes.description: Select the customer account or contact to provide a quick link to additional customer details, such as account information, activities, and opportunities.

attributes.name: customerSatisfactionCode
attributes.description: Select the customer's level of satisfaction with the handling and resolution of the case.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Type additional information to describe the case to assist the service team in reaching a resolution.

attributes.name: entitlementId
attributes.description: Choose the entitlement that is applicable for the case.

attributes.name: SLAId
attributes.description: Choose the service level agreement (SLA) that you want to apply to the case record.

attributes.name: firstResponseSLAStatus
attributes.description: Shows the status of the initial response time for the case according to the terms of the SLA.

attributes.name: followupBy
attributes.description: Enter the date by which a customer service representative has to follow up with the customer on this case.

attributes.name: followUpTaskCreated
attributes.description: This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.

attributes.name: incidentStageCode
attributes.description: Select the current stage of the service process for the case to assist service team members when they review or transfer a case.

attributes.name: isDecrementing
attributes.description: For system use only.

attributes.name: kbArticleId
attributes.description: Choose the article that contains additional information or a resolution for the case, for reference during research or follow up with the customer.

attributes.name: messageTypeCode
attributes.description: Shows whether the post originated as a public or private message.

attributes.name: priorityCode
attributes.description: Select the priority so that preferred customers or critical issues are handled quickly.

attributes.name: productId
attributes.description: Choose the product associated with the case to identify warranty, service, or other product issues and be able to report the number of incidents for each product.

attributes.name: productSerialNumber
attributes.description: Type the serial number of the product that is associated with this case, so that the number of cases per product can be reported.

attributes.name: existingCase
attributes.description: Select an existing case for the customer that has been populated. For internal use only.

attributes.name: resolveBySLAStatus
attributes.description: Shows the status of the resolution time for the case according to the terms of the SLA.

attributes.name: responsibleContactId
attributes.description: Choose an additional customer contact who can also help resolve the case.

attributes.name: sentimentValue
attributes.description: Value derived after assessing words commonly associated with a negative, neutral, or positive sentiment that occurs in a social post. Sentiment information can also be reported as numeric values.

attributes.name: influenceScore
attributes.description: Will contain the Influencer score coming from NetBreeze.

attributes.name: serviceStage
attributes.description: Select the stage, in the case resolution process, that the case is in.

attributes.name: severityCode
attributes.description: Select the severity of this case to indicate the incident's impact on the customer's business.

attributes.name: SLAInvokedId
attributes.description: Last SLA that was applied to this case. This field is for internal use only.

attributes.name: socialProfileId
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the social profile with which the case is associated.

attributes.name: stateCode
attributes.description: Shows whether the case is active, resolved, or canceled. Resolved and canceled cases are read-only and can't be edited unless they are reactivated.

attributes.name: statusCode
attributes.description: Select the case's status.

attributes.name: subjectId
attributes.description: Choose the subject for the case, such as catalog request or product complaint, so customer service managers can identify frequent requests or problem areas. Administrators can configure subjects under Business Management in the Settings area.

attributes.name: ticketNumber
attributes.description: Shows the case number for customer reference and searching capabilities. This cannot be modified.

attributes.name: masterId
attributes.description: Choose the primary case the current case was merged into.

attributes.name: parentCaseId
attributes.description: Choose the parent case for a case.

attributes.name: numberOfChildIncidents
attributes.description: Number of child incidents associated with the incident.

attributes.name: merged
attributes.description: Tells whether the incident has been merged with another incident.

attributes.name: routeCase
attributes.description: Tells whether the incident has been routed to queue or not.

attributes.name: resolveBy
attributes.description: Enter the date by when the case must be resolved.

attributes.name: responseBy
attributes.description: For internal use only.

attributes.name: customerContacted
attributes.description: Tells whether customer service representative has contacted the customer or not.

attributes.name: firstResponseSent
attributes.description: Indicates if the first response has been sent.

attributes.name: isEscalated
attributes.description: Indicates if the case has been escalated.

attributes.name: escalatedOn
attributes.description: Indicates the date and time when the case was escalated.

attributes.name: primaryContactId
attributes.description: Select a primary contact for this case.

attributes.name: onHoldTime
attributes.description: Shows the duration in minutes for which the case was on hold.

attributes.name: lastOnHoldTime
attributes.description: Contains the date time stamp of the last on hold time.

attributes.name: resolveByKPIId
attributes.description: For internal use only.

attributes.name: firstResponseByKPIId
attributes.description: For internal use only.

attributes.name: decrementEntitlementTerm
attributes.description: Shows whether terms of the associated entitlement should be decremented or not.

attributes.name: accountId
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the account with which the case is associated.

attributes.name: contactId
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the contact associated with the case.

attributes.name: exchangeRate
attributes.description: Shows the conversion rate of the record's currency. The exchange rate is used to convert all money fields in the record from the local currency to the system's default currency.

attributes.name: transactionCurrencyId
attributes.description: Choose the local currency for the record to make sure budgets are reported in the correct currency.

attributes.name: createdByExternalParty
attributes.description: Shows the external party who created the record.

attributes.name: modifiedByExternalParty
attributes.description: Shows the external party who modified the record.
